overview: From 2025-06-20 to 2025-06-21, elizaos-plugins/plugin-knowledge had 1 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 4 active contributors.

topPRs.title: fix: removing duplicate middleware and update file upload handling
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
## Problem

The knowledge plugin was experiencing consistent `"Unexpected end of form"` errors during file uploads, caused by **double parsing** of multipart form data:

1. **Global middleware**: The main server (`eliza/packages/server/src/index.ts`) already applies a global `express-fileupload` middleware to all routes
2. **Plugin middleware**: The knowledge plugin was applying its own middleware on top
3. **Result**: Attempting to re-parse an already consumed stream ‚Üí busboy error

### Error logs
```
ERROR: [KNOWLEDGE UPLOAD] Upload error:
    message: "Unexpected end of form"
    stack: "Error: Unexpected end of form
    at Multipart._final (/workspaces/node_modules/busboy/lib/types/multipart.js:588:17)"
```

## Solution

**Remove duplicate middleware and use files already parsed by the global middleware.**

### Changes Made

#### 1. Removed duplicate express-fileupload / Multer configuration
- ‚ùå Deleted `createUploadMiddleware()` function
- ‚ùå Removed import
- ‚ùå Eliminated custom middleware application logic
- ‚úÖ Simplified upload handler

#### 3. Fixed file reading logic
Updated to prioritize temporary files (used by global middleware) over in-memory buffers:

```typescript
// BEFORE: Assumed in-memory buffers
if (file.data) { fileBuffer = file.data; }

// AFTER: Prioritize temp files from global middleware
if (filePath && fs.existsSync(filePath)) {
  fileBuffer = await fs.promises.readFile(filePath);
} else if (file.data && Buffer.isBuffer(file.data)) {
  fileBuffer = file.data; // fallback
}
```

## Testing

- ‚úÖ File uploads now work without "Unexpected end of form" errors
- ‚úÖ Both single and multiple file uploads tested
- ‚úÖ Large files (130KB+) upload successfully
- ‚úÖ Logging confirms files are read from temp files as expected

## Breaking Changes

**None** - This is purely a bug fix that removes unnecessary duplicate processing.

## Performance Impact

- ‚ö° **Faster uploads**: Eliminates duplicate parsing overhead
- üõ°Ô∏è **More reliable**: Removes race conditions and connection issues
- üßπ **Cleaner code**: 80% reduction in middleware complexity

## Files Changed

- `plugin-knowledge/src/routes.ts`: Removed duplicate middleware, simplified upload handler

## Migration Notes

No migration needed. The plugin now correctly uses the existing global `express-fileupload` middleware instead of creating its own conflicting instance.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **Documentation**
  - Added a new section explaining file upload configuration, supported file types, and MIME type handling to the troubleshooting guide.

- **Chores**
  - Removed unused dependencies related to file upload handling.

- **Refactor**
  - Replaced the previous file upload middleware with a global approach, improved file validation and error handling, and updated the upload process for better reliability.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
